Posts.Content: Hope you have received the answers to your questions by now. I had a masectomy last April with 15 lymph nodes cancerous and removed. Then had 2 different chemos and 35 rounds of radiation. Have been told my cancer has come back strong already and am now on Arimidex. Understand lymphema has to do with the swelling of the arm after the removal of the lymph nodes. I am grateful I have not had that happen. Right now just daily dealing with the pain (most likely from the medications I am on) and the extreme nausea. One day at a time. Have you started your chemo? And how are you doing with it? Keep your hope up. God Bless you. Jean O
Posts.Title: Unsure of What to Ask

Posts.Content: Dear Candle 1-I have been 3 times to the Cancer Center of America in Zion, Illinois and would highly recommend it. I did not have a Dr. Ketterl but had Dr. Citrin but was very pleased with his aggresiveness with my cancer and also his attitude. Everyone at the Cancer Center is very positive and treat the whole person. Please be encouraged. I went there after being told there was "no light for me at the end of the tunne" by my local oncologist but last month was told at the cancer center that my petscan was clear for the 1st time. Now am on Arimidex and trying to regain my strength and appreciate each day the Lord gives me.
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Mets to Bone Treatments

Posts.Content: I actually ended up not having treatment but the plan was to put me either on Iressa, Tarceva or one other chemo. Since my petscan ended up being clear, I did not have treatment. Please at least call them and talk to someone there. Jean
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Mets to Bone Treatments

Posts.Content: I have been on Arimidex for 7 months and have much bone and joint pain. My onc. is willing to put me on Femera but wondering what kind of side effects others are having from it. Any info would help me make my decision whether or not to change. Jean
Posts.Title: Questions About Femera

Posts.Content: I have only been on Arimidex since Dec. but have extreme pain in my legs and arms. Even a pain patch and Percocet does not take care of it. Have had a masectomy (15 lymph nodes with cancer removed)-chemotheraphy twice and 35 sessions of radiation. No thinning of hair at this time (just getting it back) but nauseated all the time. Jean
Posts.Title: Arimidex

Posts.Content: Mary - are you going to the Cancer Center? They seem to be so helpful on all areas. I have been there twice and they refused to give me more chemo in March even though my oncologist here in town almost insisted on it. As you said, it had to do with the quality of life. I have tried Darvocet but got sick off of it. Am considering acupunture which they also do at the Cancer Center but it is so expensive here with no ins. help. Each of us are different. My sister died 17 yrs. ago from breast cancer and she had a strong threshold of pain and would take little meds until the end. I am not like that and hope you don't feel weak because you are different from your mother. God bless you in your decision. Jean
Posts.Title: Arimidex

Posts.Content: I have been on Arimidex since Dec. My tumor markers have gone down every month and have been told I can attribute that to the Arimidex. That is the good news about it. I do have much pain in my bones and joints as well as much stiffness and tiredness. Understand not everyone has the same side effects so hope you do well with the drug. Blessings. Jean
Posts.Title: Has Anybody Taken Arimidex?

Posts.Content: I seem to be having the same effects from Femera as I had with Arimidex. Was on Arimidex for 8 months with the joint and bone pain getting more severe monthly. Was then switched to Femera but it is the same. Have finally decided to try to stick it out and take l/2 Percocet when it gets really bad. Also make myself walk, exercise and try to stay active.
Posts.Title: Side Effects From Aromasin

Posts.Content: Hi-I was diagnosed with bc in April of 2004 with chemo, masectomy, more chemo and then rad. Within a year my tumor markers went back up and cancer was then found in my bone marrow. Am now on Zometa via IV and Aromasin daily. Hope you do well. Very important that we stay positive and upbeat and I have to remember I have much to be thankful for. Blessings, Jean
Posts.Title: Reoccurence

Posts.Content: Hello Carmela-I also take Zometa once a month for cancer in my bone marrow. I have tried Arimidex, Femera and now on Aromasin. All have given me much pain in my joints and bones plus Femera made my cholesteral level go up to high risk numbers. I just got on Aromasin and will try to stick it if I can. Can not imagine another 4 years of this. Hope you can get some good answers and wisdom to know what to do. Blessings, Jean
Posts.Title: my Cancer Traveled to The Bones
